subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Abby Wambach scored her 88th international goal to help the United States win the Algarve Cup for a record sixth time with a 2-1 victory against Denmark in Portugal. Wambach scored the winning goal in the 49th minute, sprinting down the right flank and breaking two tackles before exchanging passes with Natasha Kai and sending a low drive into the corner. Kai gave the Americans the lead with a header in the 14th minute, but Denmark’s Cathrine Sorensen scored in the 30th.
